title: All-language code compiler web app with smart error experience

requirements.text: Create a frontend page that lets a user write code, choose a programming language, and submit a compile/run request, then displays stdout, stderr, exit status, and timing information in a clear results layout.

quotes: Make a all language code compiler smart error experience

acceptanceCriteria: User can select a language from a dropdown and type/paste code into an editor area
User can click a primary action (e.g., “Compile & Run”) to submit the code
UI shows separate sections/tabs for Standard Output and Standard Error
UI shows a visible status for: idle, submitting, success, failure (request-level)

requirements.text: Implement a “smart error experience” in the frontend: parse compilation/runtime error text into structured diagnostics (at minimum: message, severity, and best-effort line/column when present), render an error list, and show an inline code-frame preview for a selected error with the referenced line highlighted.
acceptanceCriteria: When stderr contains line/column patterns (e.g., “line 12”, “12:5”, “(12,5)”), the UI extracts and displays line/column fields when possible
UI renders a list of errors/warnings (when multiple are present) and allows selecting an item
Selecting an error shows a code-frame snippet with the relevant line highlighted (best-effort if only line is known)
If no structure can be extracted, UI still displays raw stderr and indicates it could not locate line/column

requirements.text: Add a backend API (Motoko, single actor) that accepts a compile/run request (language identifier, source code, optional stdin, optional compile/run flags) and returns a normalized result (stdout, stderr, status/exit code, and any structured diagnostic fields available).
acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes an update method to submit jobs and returns a single normalized result object for the frontend to render
Backend validates request size limits (rejects overly large source/stdin with a clear error message)
Backend returns errors in a consistent format that the frontend can display (request error vs compilation/runtime stderr)

requirements.text: Integrate the backend with an external compilation/execution HTTP API (generic REST) to support multiple languages, with configuration for the provider base URL and any required keys/tokens stored server-side (not shipped to the browser).
acceptanceCriteria: There is a single place to configure the external provider connection (base URL + credentials) in the backend configuration approach used by the template
The frontend never requires an API key to compile/run code
At least one language can be compiled/run end-to-end through the external provider, and the system is structured so additional languages can be added via a mapping table/config

requirements.text: Use React Query on the frontend to call the backend compile/run method, including request cancellation/disable while a request is in flight, and user-visible error handling for network/provider failures.

quotes: submit code, compile via external APIs, show clear helpful errors

acceptanceCriteria: Compile/run action is disabled (or shows loading state) while a request is in flight
Network/provider failures show a readable error state with retry
Successful results are rendered without requiring a page refresh

requirements.text: Add a coherent visual theme for the app (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) and apply it consistently across the editor, controls, and results panels (do not use blue/purple as the primary palette).
acceptanceCriteria: App has a consistent, deliberate theme across all screens/components
Primary/secondary actions are visually distinct and accessible
Theme avoids blue/purple as the primary palette

requirements.text: Add generated static images to support the UI branding and render them in the frontend from frontend/public/assets/generated.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced directly by the frontend
At least one generated image is visible in the UI (e.g., header/landing area)

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in backend/main.mo).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other frontend immutablePaths; compose them from outside.
Use English for all user-facing UI text.
Do not expose external compilation provider credentials in the frontend bundle.
nonGoals: Implementing an AI/LLM-based error explainer (heuristics/parsing only).
Real-time collaboration, chat, or WebSocket streaming logs.
Third-party authentication providers other than Internet Identity.
Supporting every language out of the box; the app should be designed to be extensible, but only needs to prove end-to-end flow for at least one language initially.

required: Minimal compiler app logo mark, flat vector style, warm neutral palette (compiler-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Abstract code-themed header illustration with warm neutrals and subtle geometric shapes (compiler-hero.dim_1600x900.png)
